strings.Value: "What... what is this?"
"Did a giant come by and vomit this out?"
"Where did the glass on that statue's head come from?"
"You built a statue. Of yourself. Right near the city."
"I... like it."
"All right. It can stay."
"Tear this thing down. Carefully."
"Remove it, or I'll hang you from it."
"Wait, you actually think... never mind."
"I'll let you have your way. This time."
"I've changed my mind. Tear it down."
"I'm serious. Tear this down."
"I said, remove it, or I'll hang you from it."
"I'll leave you to it, but when I return, it better be gone."
"Just remove it from my sight. I have other matters to attend to."

{n}Nok-Nok is standing proudly, regarding the statues before you – the statues are strangely ghastly and majestic at the same time, two figures fashioned from cobbled bits of stone, wood, and something that might be either mud, plaster – or – judging by the smell — something from the cistern.{/n}

{n}The statue on the right looks vaguely like a giant version of Nok-Nok – and the other looks to be... something? Maybe a {race}, but it is of equal height to the figure on the left. Broken glass from what you strongly suspect might have been a castle window rings the '{race}' figure's head like a crown.{/n}
{n}As you study the two odd-looking statues, Nok-Nok notices you and smiles.{/n}
{n}Nok-Nok shakes his head and snorts.{/n} "No. Look harder." {n}He frowns.{/n} "Harder. See?"

{n}Nok-Nok shrugs.{/n} "Found it. After castle window break. Because rock fly through it, like bird, but no wings. Not know where rock come from, where going, but it left glass behind." {n}He smiles, then nods at the statues.{/n} "Make nice crown for you. See?"

{n}With a flourish, Nok-Nok points to the twisted mass of junk.{/n} "TWO heroes. Me, big Hero..." {n}He nods at one of the figure.{/n} "With other, smaller Big Hero." {n}He nods to the ramshackle crowned figure on the right, towering the same size as the Nok-Nok statue.{/n} "You. Both of us Heroes, together." {n}He nods, then continues, as if self-evident.{/n} "All heroes have statues. But no inscriptions. Words." {n}He shudders and makes a semi-circle in the air, as if to ward off evil.{/n}
{n}Nok-Nok nods proudly.{/n} "Of course you like it, it's perfect!" {n}He appraises the two statues, judging them side-by-side.{/n} "Even got height right."

{n}Nok-Nok suddenly turns to you, mimicking what you suddenly realize is the pose the statues are in.{/n} "Ready to stab, just point the way... two Heroes, against big beasts of the Stolen Lands!" {n}He pauses, then leans in.{/n} "But you handle bigger beasts, Nok-Nok watch."
{n}Nok-Nok doesn't seem to have heard you.{/n} "No need, it's already up, no need to tear it down!" {n}He appraises the two statues, judging them side-by-side.{/n} "Even got height right."
{n}Nok-Nok doesn't seem to have heard you.{/n} "Yes, perfect." {n}He echoes, then sighs slightly.{/n}

{n}Nok-Nok turns to you and blinks. As he looks at you, his ears begin drooping bit by bit, until they hand limply from his skull. Then he brightens.{/n} "Tearing it down – that will be fun." {n}He gives a grin, then turns to the statues, as if appraising where to attack them first.{/n} "Maybe go for knees first. Or neck. Or..."

{n}Nok-Nok doesn't seem to have heard – he has gone from appraising the statue to intently delivering short cracks with a hammer to the knees and feet of the statues. He seems lost in the activity and doesn't stop to speak as you depart.{/n}
